entry.value: Tips and Tricks
Displays helpful tips that gives the user an introduction to the features in Sitemagic CMS
Disable tips
Some features in Sitemagic CMS requires some explaination. Are you absolutely sure you want to disable tips?
Welcome to Sitemagic CMS
Thank you for choosing Sitemagic CMS for your new website.
To help you get started with Sitemagic CMS, tips and tricks will be shown the first time you browse to a module in the control panel.
Some features require some explaination. It is recommended to keep Tips and Tricks turned on.
Click the small X in the upper right corner to temporarily close the tip.
Click the green Ok button to permanently close a tip - it will not show up again.
Click the red Disable button to disable all tips.
Enjoy your new website :-)
Content menu
Use this menu to change the Design, update the Menu, add and edit Pages, or manage your Files.
Admin menu
Most configuration is done from this menu. Go to Admin > Settings to enable more functionality.
Select a folder to list files within. Use the buttons to Create, Rename, or Delete folders.
Files contained in selected folder is listed here. Select a file and use the buttons to Download, Rename, or Delete it. Use the Upload button to add new files to the selected folder.
Link form
Use this form to create new links, or edit existing links.
Link picker
This button lets you easily select a page or extension to link to.
Menu structure

Click on a link to select it. Use the buttons to Edit the link, Delete it, or move it Up and Down the hierarchy. If a link is selected, new links will automatically be added to a drop down menu underneath it.
Use this form to create new pages, or edit their properties. Click More Options to set a custom Design Template, work with meta data, or set a password.
Existing pages are listed here. Select a page and click the Edit Content button to open the Page Editor.
Header and Footer
Click Edit to change the content of the Header or Footer section.
Save page
Use this button to save the changes. If this is a new page, you may want to add it to the menu under Content > Menu.
Insert link
Select some text or an image, and click this button to turn it into a link to another page, to a file, or to another website.
Use this menu to select a page, file, or extension to link to.
Insert image
Use this button to insert an image where the cursor is currently positioned.
Use this menu to select an image to insert. Images are uploaded under Content > Files to the images folder.
Cards design

Use this menu to switch the layout to cards. Once the layout is changed you can press ENTER to create new cards and use this menu to change the size of each card. To create line breaks, simply press Shift+Enter.
Insert Page Extension

Click here to add Page Extensions like Contact Forms, External Modules (e.g. YouTube, Maps, or Music.), Comment box, Ratings, and more. Page Extensions are enabled and disabled under Admin > Settings.
Move the mouse around to have editable elements outlined. Click an element to change its look and feel in the Designer. Click the Save button to save the changes.
Contact forms
Contact Forms are Page Extension that are added to pages using the Page Editor under Content > Pages.
Edit contact form
To edit a Contact Form, simply select it here.
Basic configuration
Configure the Contact Form with your e-mail address, a subject for the e-mails you receive, and a message displayed to the user after a message has been sent.
Use this form to create or edit input fields in the contact form.
Input fields
This is a list of input fields in the Contact Form. Select a field and click on one of the buttons to Edit, Delete, or move it Up and Down.
External Modules

External Modules can be used to add content or functionality from another website, e.g. YouTube videos, Google Maps, or SoundCloud music. Use the Extensions button in the Page Editor to insert a module into a page.
Existing modules
To edit an existing External Module, simply select it here.
Create or edit
Use this form to create or edit External Modules. To insert a YouTube video, follow these steps:
Find a video on YouTube and copy the URL from the address bar.
Enter a name for the module in Module Name, e.g. My Video.
Paste the URL from step 1 into the URL Address field.
Click the Create button.
Go to Content > Pages and open a Page for editing.
Click the Extensions button underneath the Save button and insert the module.
Photo album
Use this form to change how Image Montage lays out photos. To create a photo album, follow these steps:
Go to Content > Files and create a new folder under the "gallery" folder.
Click on the newly created folder to select it and use the Upload button to add photos to it.
Go to Content > Menu and use the Select button to add a link to the new album to the menu.
Change login
Change your username and password here (highly recommended).
Look and feel
Change the look and feel of your website by applying another Design Template or different icons. The Copy and Delete buttons are used to manage copies of Design Templates.

Select extensions (plug-ins) to use. How to access and use extensions differ. Some extensions add an entry to the Admin menu, some are made available to the Page Editor, while others can be added directly to the Menu. Extenions may even use all three approaches described.
